summary: This document contains the trust agreement for 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust ONE' dated November 8, 2001, and an amendment from 2003. The trust outlines the disposition of Epstein's assets upon his death, including specific bequests to family, associates, and Ghislaine Maxwell. The 2003 amendment removes Jeffrey A. Schantz as co-Trustee and replaces him with Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman.

events.title: Establishment of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust ONE
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein, as Grantor, establishes a trust with himself and Jeffrey A. Schantz as initial Trustees, outlining the posthumous distribution of his assets.

events.title: Amendment to the 2001 Trust
events.description: Epstein amends the trust to remove Jeffrey A. Schantz as co-Trustee and appoint Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman as successor co-Trustees.

keyFacts: In 2003, Jeffrey Epstein removed Jeffrey A. Schantz as a co-Trustee of his 2001 trust and replaced him with Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman, significantly elevating Maxwell's financial and fiduciary role.

The trust designates Ghislaine Maxwell to receive income from trust assets, the right to use residences, and the authority to select one of Epstein's residential properties for distribution to an unnamed individual.

Substantial bequests are outlined: $10 million each to Mark Lawrence Epstein (brother) and Jeffrey A. Schantz, and forgiveness of debts owed by Mark Epstein, Robert Goodman (cousin), and Robert Gold (friend).
The trust references an unnamed individual (redacted in the text) multiple times as a beneficiary, including provisions for residential property distribution and separate trusts.
The trust is governed by the laws of the United States Virgin Islands, a jurisdiction known for its favorable trust laws.
